alert.note: Alert for Central and East Adams and Arapahoe Counties; Central and South Weld County; Logan County; Morgan County; North and Northeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, North Lincoln County; Northeast Weld County; Phillips County; Sedgwick County; Southeast Elbert County Below 6000 Feet, South Lincoln County; Washington County (Colorado) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued September 08 at 3:08AM MDT until September 08 at 8:00PM MDT by NWS Boulder
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 10 AM THIS MORNING TO 8 PM MDT THIS EVENING FOR WIND AND LOW RELATIVE HUMIDITY FOR THE EASTERN PLAINS OF COLORADO... * Affected Area...Fire Weather Zones 242, 243, 244, 245, 246, 247, 248, 249, 250 and 251. * Timing...10 AM Thursday morning until 8 PM Thursday evening. * Winds...Southwest 10 to 20 mph with gusts up to 35 mph, becoming northwest late in the afternoon and early evening. * Relative Humidity...As low as 8 percent. * Impacts...Record heat and low humidity, very dry fuels, and breezy conditions means that rapid fire spread will be possible. Avoid burning or any outdoor activities that may produce a spark and start a wildfire.
info.instruction: A Red Flag Warning means that critical fire weather conditions are either occurring now....or will shortly. A combination of strong winds...low relative humidity...and warm temperatures can contribute to extreme fire behavior.
